Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: French
My French speaking improved.

We learned different tenses and vocabulary in french and became more comfortable with speaking the language. We also read texts and watched movies in french to grow more comfortable with the language.
better understanding of tenses, improved comprehension
I learned French grammar and vocabulary and culture
I greatly developed my knowledge of French.
Very important foundational overview of grammar, writing, and speaking necessary to become advanced in French.

Strengths - lots of course content, enjoyed doing french media and stories

weaknesses - less focus on grammatical rules, more on immersion (which is hard when you don't know the rules in french). would be useful to have english resources as supplements to enable you to learn the rules as a complement to everything else
I greatly appreciated the daily exercises and weekly quizzes. They were very helpful.

Strengths are the comfort achieved in the class/ ease of speaking, the diversity of the course material, the number of practice exercises available, 
Weaknesses is the workload/ demanding nature of the course; sometimes the professor can be condescending or not foster a positive educational environment, we never really went over tests/ quizzes, many assignments got lost
weaknesses: class meets every day, not much clear feedback on how to improve writing . strengths: emphasis on discussion

I really enjoyed this course! The teaching was good and class discussions were interesting. The books/movies were explained well so that we could understand them. I learned a lot in this class. However it is challenging and the work load is pretty heavy.
I enjoyed this course. I am not sure on how it can be improved.

I think the structure of the course works really well. A student is set up for success if he or she simply sticks to the curriculum and studies the tools provided. Additionally, the course is a lot of fun, which is a big strength. A highlight of the semester!
sure. i mean french is fun
Yes! All the classes were fun, which was great especially because  the class meets every weekday.
Only for students who truly want to improve their foreign language skills, not for fun/hobby
Yes ! Yale french is challenging but amazing. L3 is incredibly difficult but you read books/ watch movies that are at the very least helpful, insightful, interesting.
Yes, the course is great for those who truly want to learn French.

I would recommend this class to another student. The course is engaging and conducive for student learning. While the workload is quite significant, classes are very enjoyable and I took a lot out of this class.
Yes, absolutely!
